coffee_details.description: Coffee is a popular beverage made from the roasted seeds (coffee beans) of the Coffea plant. It is enjoyed worldwide for its rich flavor, aroma, and stimulating effects.
coffee_details.cultivation: Coffee plants thrive in tropical and subtropical regions with well-drained soil, high altitude, and consistent rainfall. They require shade during the early stages of growth and sunlight for fruit development.
coffee_details.processing methods: Washed (wet) process, Natural (dry) process, Honey process

prerequisites.soil: Rich, well-drained soil with pH between 6.0 and 6.5
prerequisites.climate: Tropical or subtropical climate with temperatures between 60°F to 70°F (15°C to 24°C) and rainfall evenly distributed throughout the year
prerequisites.altitude: Ideal altitude varies by variety, but generally between 2,000 to 6,000 feet (600 to 1,800 meters) above sea level for Arabica, and lower for Robusta.
prerequisites.sunlight: Coffee plants require ample sunlight, but some shade during the early stages of growth helps prevent sunburn.
prerequisites.water: Consistent rainfall or irrigation to maintain soil moisture, especially during flowering and fruit development.
prerequisites.frost: Protection from frost, as coffee plants are sensitive to low temperatures.
prerequisites.space: Spacing varies by variety and cultivation method, typically 6-10 feet apart for planting.
